pdhp239:1: Enduring patience is the supreme austerity, Nibbāna is supreme say the Buddhas,
pdhp239:2: for one gone forth does not hurt another, nor does an ascetic harass another.
pdhp240:1: Those sages without violence, constantly restrained in body,
pdhp240:2: go to the deathless Nibbāna, having gone there they do not grieve.
pdhp241:1: Gotama’s disciples always awake to a good wakening,
pdhp241:2: those who day and night have a mind that delights in non-violence.
pdhp242:1: Gotama’s disciples always awake to a good wakening,
pdhp242:2: those who day and night have a mind that delights in cultivation.
pdhp243:1: Gotama’s disciples always awake to a good wakening,
pdhp243:2: those who day and night constantly have mindfulness of the body.
pdhp244:1: Those wise ones intent on meditation, who delight in the peace of renunciation,
pdhp244:2: even the gods are envious of them, the Sambuddhas, the ones who are mindful.
pdhp245:1: Whether in the wilds or village, whether on low or on high ground,
pdhp245:2: wherever the Arahats live, that ground is surely delightful.
pdhp246:1: If, for even one living being, one with an uncorrupt mind, has loving-kindness, there is wholesomeness in that,
pdhp246:2: but the one with compassion in mind for all living beings, that noble one makes abundant merit.
pdhp247:1: Those who conquered the earth, crowded with beings, those royal seers who went round sacrificing:
pdhp247:2: the horse sacrifice, the man sacrifice, the stick-casting, the soma offering, the unobstructed—
pdhp247:3: compared to the one who develops his mind with loving-kindness, they do not partake of even a sixteenth part,
pdhp247:4: just as the whole host of stars do not partake of the radiance of the moon.
pdhp248:1: Then he who with a mind of loving-kindness has compassion for all living beings,
pdhp248:2: having loving-kindness towards all beings, he has no one who is hated.
pdhp249:1: For he who every day and night delights in a mind of non-violence,
pdhp249:2: having loving-kindness towards all beings, he has no one who is hated.
pdhp250:1: For he who every day and night has a mind that delights in cultivation,
pdhp250:2: having loving-kindness towards all beings, he has no one who is hated.
pdhp251:1: For he who every day and night constantly has mindfulness of the body,
pdhp251:2: having loving-kindness towards all beings, he has no one who is hated.
pdhp252:1: He who neither kills, nor has killed, conquers, nor has conquered,
pdhp252:2: having loving-kindness towards all beings, he has no one who is hated.
pdhp253:1: For not by hatred do hatreds cease at any time in this place,
pdhp253:2: they only cease with non-hatred, this truth is surely eternal.
pdhp254:1: The others do not understand that we should be successful here,
pdhp254:2: but for those here who do understand, through that, their dissensions do cease.
pdhp255:1: Let us live truly happily, without hatred, amongst those who have hatred,
pdhp255:2: amongst humans who have hatred let us live without hatred.
pdhp256:1: Let us live truly happily, without longing, amongst those who are longing,
pdhp256:2: amongst humans who are longing let us live without longing.
pdhp257:1: We live truly happily enough having no possessions ourselves,
pdhp257:2: amongst those with possessions let us live having no possessions.
pdhp258:1: One should see it as a bubble, one should see it as a mirage,
pdhp258:2: looking on the world in this way the King of Death does not see one.
pdhp259:1: This body is worn out, a nest of disease, perishing,
pdhp259:2: the putrid body comes to destruction, for life ends in death.
pdhp260:1: Having seen an old man, one afflicted and sick, having seen one deceased, after not long for the student,
pdhp260:2: anxiety, sharp and extensive, arose, and the wise one cut the household bonds.
